item.title: Parents dropping off kids Woolwich poly school for girls, 11th June
item.description:

item.title: Yet more flytipping, 11th June
item.description:
Third time messaging in a weeks: thanks for the swift response each time but this spot seems to have become a popular dumping ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramerton Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Old bed fly tipped on Fingal Street, 11th June
item.description:
An old bed has been fly tipped at the top of Fingal Street where it joins the Woolwich Road. Please remove. This is not the first time that it happened. Notorious fly tipping spot. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fingal Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London

item.category: Street cleaning - Grass verges / Shrub beds - Littering

item.title: Large holes in road surface, 11th June
item.description:
These potholes have been here for the last 4 months and are getting worse, it appears to be caused by heavy goods vehicles using the road the conditions are becoming dangerous for drivers and have the potential to cause expensive damage to vehicles

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ardra Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Follow up on original request dated 29 April, 11th June
item.description:
These overgrown weeds at the back of 33-43 Ampleforth Road were originally reported on 29 April. It was marked as fixed as part of the next weekly cleanse. It hasn't been resolved and the weeds are now above the height of my window ledges and obstructing my windows, which I can't open because the weeds are covered in blackfly and thorns.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sewell Road, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Black refuse bags left on pavement, 11th June
item.description:
This pile of black refuse bags of building waste has been left outside the property (Leontine Close) for several months and is attracting more rubbish. It needs to be cleared to avoid it getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Furley Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Flies swamming over rubbish in skip, 11th June
item.description:
This skip is full of bin bags and a visible box with bananas! It has attracted so many flies and myself and my neighbours are experiencing so many flies from this! Please help

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Pot holes and defects, 11th June
item.description:
